item.title: Australia Wildfires Burn Nearly 900,000 Acres
item.description: Blazes in the state of Victoria have destroyed hundreds of structures, including homes, and killed one person, the authorities said.
item.dc:creator: Yan Zhuang

media:content.media:credit: Michael Currie/Australian Associated Press, via Reuters
media:content.media:description: Smoke rising from a burning forest near Longwood, Australia, on Friday.

item.title: Trump Broke the World Order. Now What?
item.description: With the president’s actions in Venezuela, we’re entering a new era. Here’s what it could look like.

item.title: Trump’s Amoral World Meets Its Match in Pope Leo
item.description: The pontiff has increasingly asserted himself in the face of Trump’s aggressive words and deeds.
item.dc:creator: David Gibson

item.title: María Corina Machado ofreció su Nobel a Trump, pero el Instituto Nobel dice que no está permitido
item.description: El Instituto Nobel noruego aclaró las normas que rigen el premio, al escribir que los hechos estaban “claros y bien establecidos”
item.dc:creator: Jonathan Wolfe

media:content.media:credit: Adriana Loureiro Fernandez para The New York Times
media:content.media:description: María Corina Machado, líder de la oposición venezolana, se ofreció a entregar su Premio Nobel de la Paz al presidente Trump, quien codicia el galardón desde hace tiempo.

item.title: Quote of the Day: Beyond Fences, Ranchers See a Range of Possibilities
item.description: Quotation of the Day for Sunday, January 11, 2026.

item.title: How Kit Harington Left Jon Snow Behind
item.description: The actor crashed after “Game of Thrones.” Now, as he returns in a new season of “Industry” on HBO, he feels like “one of the luckiest people alive.”
item.dc:creator: Miles Ellingham and Charlotte Hadden

media:content.media:credit: Charlotte Hadden for The New York Times

item.title: India’s Ties With Bangladesh Fray as Elections Loom
item.description: A simmering dispute between the neighbors, who share one of the largest land borders in the world, has escalated with diplomatic protests and a sports boycott.
item.dc:creator: Mujib Mashal and Saif Hasnat

media:content.media:credit: Sonu Mehta/Hindustan Times, via Getty Images
media:content.media:description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi of India and then Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina of Bangladesh in New Delhi in 2024. Ms. Hasina was ousted by a protest movement and fled to India, which has since been criticized by Bangladesh’s interim government and the protesters who ousted her for refusing to hand her over to face justice at home.

item.title: Corrections: Jan. 11, 2026
item.description: Corrections that appeared in print on Sunday, Jan. 11, 2026.

item.title: Bob Weir: 10 Essential Songs
item.description: The guitarist, singer and songwriter, who died at 78, cut his own path among his elders in the Grateful Dead, and beyond.
item.dc:creator: David Browne

media:content.media:description: Bob Weir sang on “Truckin’,” one of the Grateful Dead’s defining tracks.

item.title: Smithsonian Removes Label Noting Trump Impeachments
item.description: When the National Portrait Gallery replaced a portrait of President Trump this week, it took down a biography of his first term.
item.dc:creator: Graham Bowley, Robin Pogrebin and Derrick Bryson Taylor

media:content.media:description: An earlier photograph of President Trump that hung at the National Portrait Gallery included lengthy wall text.

item.title: Death Toll Grows as Nationwide Protests Rock Iran for a Third Night
item.description: Antigovernment unrest that began two weeks ago has intensified in recent days, as has violence.
item.dc:creator: Farnaz Fassihi and Malachy Browne
item.category: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations

media:content.media:credit: UGC, via Agence France-Presse — Getty Images
media:content.media:description: A still from video shared on social media on Friday that has been verified by The New York Times showing crowds around an open fire in Tehran, Iran’s capital.

item.title: Judge Pauses Trump Policy Ending Family Reunification for Some Migrants
item.description: The policy applied to migrants from some Central and South American countries who were awaiting visas.
item.dc:creator: Adam Sella

media:content.media:description: Cuban migrants waited to be processed to seek asylum after crossing the border into the United States in 2023.

item.title: Venezuela’s New Leader Enlists U.S. Troops to Bring a Rogue Ship Back
item.description: Delcy Rodríguez got American help with the return of an oil tanker linked to one of her political rivals that had left the country without authorization.
item.dc:creator: Anatoly Kurmanaev and Christiaan Triebert
item.category: United States Defense and Military Forces

media:content.media:credit: Alejandro Cegarra for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Delcy Rodríguez, the interim leader of Venezuela, in the country’s capital, Caracas, on Monday.

item.title: Who Was Renee Good, the Woman Killed by an ICE Agent in Minneapolis?
item.description: Ms. Good, 37, was a poet and a mother who grew up in Colorado. Her wife said the couple had “stopped to support our neighbors” when Ms. Good was shot.
item.dc:creator: Nicholas Bogel-Burroughs, Ann Hinga Klein and Dan Simmons

media:content.media:description: Protests took place in cities and towns across the country following the killing of Renee Good.

item.title: Trump Is Briefed on Options for Striking Iran as Protests Continue
item.description: The president has said he will be “hitting them very hard” if Iranian leaders kill protesters amid widespread demonstrations calling for wholesale changes in the country.
item.dc:creator: Tyler Pager, Eric Schmitt and Edward Wong
item.category: United States Defense and Military Forces

media:content.media:description: Demonstrators protested in Tehran on Thursday.

item.title: Bob Weir, Guitarist and Founding Member of The Grateful Dead, Dies at 78
item.description: His songwriting and rhythm guitar playing helped shape the San Francisco band’s sound as it became an American institution.
item.dc:creator: Ben Sisario and Mark Walker

media:content.media:description: Bob Weir in 1976. Over a career that spanned more than 60 years, he helped shape the sound of American rock.

item.title: U.S. Launches Major Strikes on Islamic State Targets in Syria
item.description: The airstrikes followed an even larger attack in December to avenge the killing of three Americans last year.
item.dc:creator: Eric Schmitt
item.category: United States Defense and Military Forces
Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)

media:content.media:description: A view of the Sheikh Maksoud neighborhood amid fighting in Aleppo, Syria, on Jan. 10.

item.title: Paul Haggis Reaches $2 Million Settlement After 2022 Rape Verdict
item.description: A judge had ordered the Oscar-winning filmmaker to pay at least $7.5 million to a former film-industry publicist after a civil jury found him liable for raping her.
item.dc:creator: Derrick Bryson Taylor

media:content.media:description: Paul Haggis, who won two Oscars for “Crash” (2004), had maintained that the sexual encounter was consensual.

item.title: It’s All Greek
item.description: Dylan Schiff’s latest puzzle is hugely symbolic.
item.dc:creator: Caitlin Lovinger

media:content.media:description: A group of actresses, at the sanctuary where the Olympic Games were born in Greece, performed a dance at the lighting ceremony for the 2012 Summer Olympics.

item.title: Disinformation in Minneapolis Shooting Points at People Who Were Not Involved
item.description: Within hours of an ICE officer shooting and killing a woman, social media users misidentified the agent who fired as Steve Grove.
item.dc:creator: Pooja Salhotra and Tiffany Hsu

media:content.media:credit: Jenn Ackerman for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: The Minnesota Star Tribune publisher Steve Grove in 2024.

item.title: Nearly 13,000 Irish Passports Are Recalled Over ‘Technical Issue’
item.description: The recall affects passports issued between Dec. 23 and Jan. 6, Ireland’s Department of Foreign Affairs and Trade said.
item.dc:creator: Ashley Ahn

media:content.media:description: A “technical issue with a software update” may prevent Irish citizens from traveling with passports issued between Dec. 23 and Jan. 6, the country’s foreign affairs department said.

item.title: Anti-ICE Protests Spread Nationwide After Minneapolis Shooting
item.description: Demonstrators across the country expressed anger at the killing of a woman in Minneapolis by federal immigration agents.
item.dc:creator: Chris Hippensteel

media:content.media:credit: Jordan Gale for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Protesters in Portland, Ore., gathered along the downtown waterfront on Saturday morning.

item.title: Mamdani Announces Plan to Expand Public Bathroom Access in New York
item.description: The city has over eight million residents and only around 1,000 public bathrooms. The new mayor said he was committed to creating more, though he did not say when they would be available.
item.dc:creator: Maia Coleman

media:content.media:credit: Anna Watts for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Mayor Zohran Mamdani said on Saturday that he would commit $4 million to a request for proposals seeking bids for modular public restrooms, which can be installed above ground.

item.title: Monkeys Are on the Loose in St. Louis, City Officials Say
item.description: As many as four vervet monkeys were spotted in a neighborhood in North St. Louis on Thursday, city officials said. No one knows how they got there.
item.dc:creator: Rylee Kirk

media:content.media:description: A vervet monkey, part of a colony in Dania Beach, Fla., in 2022. As many as four vervet monkeys have been spotted in St. Louis in recent days, city officials said.

item.title: Protests Against ICE in Minneapolis Continue Into Friday Night
item.description: Hundreds of protesters marched through downtown Minneapolis on Friday night. They stopped at several hotels along the way to blast music, bang drums and play instruments to try to disrupt the sleep of immigration agents who might be staying there. Mayor Jacob Frey of Minneapolis said there were 29 arrests but that it was mostly a “peaceful protest.”
item.dc:creator: McKinnon de Kuyper

media:content.media:credit: Ryan Murphy for The New York Times

item.title: Stewart Cheifet, Host of TV’s ‘Computer Chronicles,’ Dies at 87
item.description: He spent two decades hosting the PBS series, during the formative years of personal computing. It was seen in more than 300 cities at its peak.
item.dc:creator: Trip Gabriel

item.title: Fetty Wap, ‘Trap Queen’ Rapper, Is Released Early From Prison
item.description: The Grammy-nominated singer was sentenced to six years in 2023 for drug trafficking. A representative said a bipartisan criminal justice law had enabled his release.
item.dc:creator: Derrick Bryson Taylor

media:content.media:description: Fetty Wap pleaded guilty in 2022 to conspiracy to possess and distribute 500 grams or more of cocaine.

item.title: El truco de Trump para desarmar la democracia estadounidense
item.description: El presidente hace uso de un poder sin contrapesos para atacar a sus enemigos, reales o percibidos, tanto en el extranjero como en casa.
item.dc:creator: Lydia Polgreen

item.title: Death Toll From California Wild Mushroom Poisoning Rises to 3
item.description: The death of a Sonoma County resident last week prompted public health officials to urge foragers not to consume wild mushrooms.
item.dc:creator: Hannah Ziegler

media:content.media:description: More than two dozen illnesses in California in recent months have been linked to the consumption of wild mushrooms, public health officials said.

item.title: FBI’s Inquiry Into Minneapolis ICE Shooting Faces Doubts After White House’s Remarks
item.description: Ex-law enforcement officials said the administration’s declarations that the killing was justified elicited questions about the F.B.I.’s willingness to scrutinize the agent who fatally shot an unarmed activist.
item.dc:creator: Glenn Thrush

media:content.media:description: Police taped off a maroon S.U.V. vehicle in which Renee Good was shot by a federal agent in south Minneapolis on Wednesday.

item.title: Delcy Rodríguez, de revolucionaria a elegida por Trump
item.description: Rodríguez, hija de un guerrillero, empezó como agitadora. Luego viró para reactivar una economía devastada, lo que la convirtió en vital para los planes estadounidenses de dirigir Venezuela.
item.dc:creator: Simon Romero and Anatoly Kurmanaev

media:content.media:credit: Adriana Loureiro Fernandez para The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Delcy Rodríguez, entonces vicepresidenta de Venezuela, durante una entrevista el año pasado.

item.title: ICE Is a Virtual Secret Police
item.description: The shooting in Minneapolis is just the latest sign.
item.dc:creator: Jamelle Bouie

item.title: Machado Offered Trump Her Nobel, but Prize Institute Says It’s Not Allowed
item.description: After María Corina Machado, Venezuela’s opposition leader, offered her Nobel Peace Prize to President Trump, the Norwegian Nobel Institute said it cannot be “transferred to others.”
item.dc:creator: Jonathan Wolfe

media:content.media:credit: Adriana Loureiro Fernandez for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: María Corina Machado, Venezuela’s opposition leader, offered to give her Nobel Peace Prize to President Trump, who has long coveted the award.

item.title: This Quick Murgh Chole Is ‘Perfection’
item.description: Zainab Shah’s chicken and chickpea curry is already racking up raves from readers: “Absolutely stunning taste!”
item.dc:creator: Mia Leimkuhler

media:content.media:credit: Linda Xiao for The New York Times. Food Stylist: Monica Pierini.
media:content.media:description: Zainab Shah’s murgh chole.

item.title: Six Dead in Mississippi Shooting; Suspect in Custody, Clay County Sheriff Says
item.description: The authorities in Clay County, Miss., arrested a 24-year-old man after a 7-year-old girl and five more people were killed.
item.dc:creator: Rick Rojas and Pooja Salhotra

media:content.media:credit: Rory Doyle for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Sheriff Eddie Scott of Clay County, Miss., said on Saturday that his office was investigating after multiple people had been killed.

item.title: Timothy Busfield, Actor and Director, Is Accused of Child Sex Abuse
item.description: The Emmy Award-winning actor is accused of abusing two child actors while working on a television series. An arrest warrant was issued in New Mexico.
item.dc:creator: John Yoon

media:content.media:description: Timothy Busfield in Pasadena, Calif. in 2020.

item.title: Make-Ahead Breakfasts Worth Getting Out of Bed For
item.description: Good morning, banana olive oil muffins, baked oatmeal bars and sweet corn tamal.
item.dc:creator: Vaughn Vreeland

media:content.media:credit: Christopher Testani for The New York Times. Food Stylist: Yossy Arefi.
media:content.media:description: Carolina Gelen’s vegan banana olive oil muffins.

item.title: Bird Flu Viruses Raise Mounting Concerns Among Scientists
item.description: Researchers are not just worried about the virus popping up on American farms. Other types are causing trouble around the world.
item.dc:creator: Apoorva Mandavilli

media:content.media:credit: Tim Gruber for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: The milking parlor of a Wisconsin dairy farm. The Agriculture Department announced the first detection of bird flu in a herd in the state, the third time the virus had jumped from wildlife into dairy cattle last year.

item.title: American Violence Is Pushing Families to Think About Leaving
item.description: I asked why so many women were considering leaving the country. The guns, several responded.
item.dc:creator: Jessica Grose

item.title: $100 Billion to Revive Venezuela’s Energy Industry? Oil Executives Are Not So Sure
item.description: During a meeting at the White House, the industry leaders appeared wary of making long-term investments in the country.

media:content.media:description: President Trump takes questions from members of the news media during a meeting with oil and gas executives on Friday.

item.title: Acquired Tastes
item.description: The dream of cohabitating with a group of friends is an attractive fantasy, but we can benefit from its lessons, regardless of our living situation.
